qas.question: Who is considered the founding father of Tuscan?
What year did Mexico gain independence from Spain?
Who founded the Mission San Xavier del Bac?
How many miles was Mission San Xavier del Bac from Tuscon?
Which missionary came to the Santa Cruz River area in 1692?
When did Kino found the del Bac mission?

context: <a5_0>Jesuit<a5_0/> missionary <a2_0><a4_0>Eusebio Francisco Kino<a4_0/><a2_0/> visited the Santa Cruz River valley in 1692, and founded the <a6_0>Mission San Xavier del Bac<a6_0/> in <a7_0>1700<a7_0/> about <a3_0>7<a3_0/> mi (11 km) upstream from the site of the settlement of Tucson. A separate Convento settlement was founded downstream along the Santa Cruz River, near the base of what is now "A" mountain. <a0_0><a8_0>Hugo O'Conor<a8_0/><a0_0/>, the founding father of the city of Tucson, Arizona authorized the construction of a military fort in that location, Presidio San Agustín del Tucsón, on August 20, 1775 (near the present downtown Pima County Courthouse). During the Spanish period of the presidio, attacks such as the Second Battle of Tucson were repeatedly mounted by Apaches. Eventually the town came to be called "Tucson" and became a part of Sonora after Mexico gained independence from Spain in <a1_0>1821<a1_0/>.
